channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Ex-Trump adviser Steve Bannon and three others charged with fraud
Bannon could face many years in jail if convicted, analysts say
Bannon is among four charged with defrauding donors to border wall campaign
item.description: Federal prosecutors charged Steve Bannon, President Donald Trump's former campaign adviser, and three others with defrauding donors of hundreds of thousands of dollars in a border wall fundraising campaign. Bannon has been arrested, according to a spokesman for the US attorney's office. Bannon's lawyer did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

item.title: Barack Obama issues a stunning rebuke of Trump
Recap night three of the Democratic Convention in under 2 minutes
item.description: President Barack Obama made a passionate appeal, singer Billie Eilish got political, and Hillary Clinton warned voters about the mistakes of 2016.

item.title: Judge rules against Trump in tax records subpoena fight
item.description: A federal judge on Thursday sided with New York state prosecutors who are attempting to get access to President Donald Trump's accounting records for a grand jury investigation.

item.title: Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny was 'groaning loudly' on flight after alleged poisoning
Sweden records highest death tally in 150 years in first half of 2020
item.description: Sweden recorded its highest death tally in 150 years for the first half of 2020, according to the country's official statistics office.

item.title: A controversy in Australia signals the next Covid-19 nightmare
WHO: 26,000 daily new cases in Europe since restrictions eased
In the middle of a pandemic, Trump is in overdrive planning his own convention
This is one of the most dangerous things Donald Trump has done as president
item.description: On Wednesday, President Donald Trump did something incredibly dangerous.

item.title: Kushner's secret push to sell F-35 jets to UAE causes confusion and frustration
item.description: A secret push by President Donald Trump's senior adviser Jared Kushner to sell advanced arms -- including F-35 stealth fighter jets -- to the United Arab Emirates has caused confusion and frustration among agencies and congressional committees that would normally be involved in such a sale but have been left in the dark.

item.title: Scientists say they've figured the odds of catching Covid on a plane
item.description: Sitting squeezed between a number of strangers on board an aircraft might feel like a risky position during these uncertain times.

item.title: These variables affect whether you live, die or get help during the pandemic
item.description: As the US continues to grapple with the dual crises of coronavirus and racism, two things have become clear: People of color are being hit hardest by the virus, and systemic inequities are largely to blame.

item.title: Many leaders used Covid as cover to dent democracy. Trump may be the first to openly admit it
item.description: In the months since Covid-19 swept the globe, leaders the world over have been accused of exploiting the pandemic for political gain while laying waste to democratic norms. Few, if any, have gone as far as to reveal those plans publicly.

item.title: Hear Dr. Gupta's pointed message to Georgia's Governor
item.description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta responds to Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp's latest comments regarding coronavirus information being released, in which Kemp called the leaked report "pandemic politics."

item.title: CNN team was tracked by Russian operatives, investigation shows
item.description: A new investigation has found evidence that CNN journalists in the Central African Republic (CAR) last year were subject to constant surveillance by a team of Russian operatives.

item.title: Uber and Lyft prepare to shut down in California over new law
item.description: Uber and Lyft could be hours away from shutting down rideshare services in their home state of California amid a heated legal battle over a new law impacting how much of the on-demand economy classifies its workers.

item.title: Boeing wins first order this year for 737 Max planes
item.description: Boeing has secured its first order for the troubled 737 Max in nine months.

item.title: While Obama gave his DNC speech, Trump sent hate tweets
item.description: CNN's Chris Cuomo and Jeremy Diamond fact check President Trump's tweets that were posted as former President Barack Obama gave his speech at the 2020 Democratic National Convention.

item.title: Gold diggers unearth historic nuggets
item.description: Gold diggers in southern Australia have found two huge nuggets worth $350,000 AUD ($250,000 USD) in historic goldfields.

item.title: The BlackBerry is coming back
item.description: BlackBerry has been left for dead countless times over the past decade, but it refuses to go away. Two years after the last (we thought) BlackBerry phone, the BlackBerry logo will appear once again on a smartphone, complete with its famous, honest-to-goodness, physical QWERTY keyboard.

item.title: 750 million genetically engineered mosquitoes approved for release in Florida Keys
item.description: A plan to release millions of genetically modified mosquitoes in 2021 has won final approval from authorities in the Florida Keys, despite the objection of many local residents and a coalition of environmental advocacy groups.

item.title: Top ex-Obama strategist: Let me just be really clear ...
item.description: David Axelrod, who advised former President Barack Obama, assesses the speech the former president delivered tonight at the Democratic National Convention.

item.title: Airbnb says parties are now banned
item.description: Addressing an ongoing problem with unauthorized parties at Airbnb listings that has been aggravated by the pandemic and public health risks, the rental behemoth issued a ban Thursday on parties at properties worldwide.

item.title: Dramatic new bodycam footage shows Sheriff's Deputy shoved Raptors' president during altercation
item.description: Dramatic new footage has emerged of the altercation between Toronto Raptors' president, Masai Ujiri, and a San Francisco Bay Area police officer, following the Canadian team's decisive game 6 victory in the NBA Finals last year.

item.title: Brother of Ariana Grande concert bomber given 55 years in prison
item.description: Hashem Abedi, the brother of the Manchester Arena bomber Salman Abedi, was sentenced Thursday to at least 55 years in prison for his involvement in the Ariana Grande concert attack that killed 22 people in May 2017.

item.title: Lightning strikes lead to wildfires across two states
item.description: Nearly 11,000 lightning strikes have sparked 367 wildfires, with more than 300,000 acres burned across California, according to a Cal Fire spokesman. At least four blazes have already burned more than 150,000 acres in Colorado.

item.title: Alibaba sales soar but US crackdown may be looming
item.description: China's economy has bounced back from the Covid-19 outbreak in China's Wuhan province. That's great news for Alibaba, the e-commerce and cloud giant. But the company also acknowledged the threat of being caught up in the burgeoning trade war between the United States and China.

item.title: This app can tell you if you're drinking fake alcohol
item.description: How do you know whether the product you are buying is the real deal and not an inferior or harmful knockoff?

item.title: Germans could legally have to let their dogs out twice a day
item.description: Dog owners in Germany could be legally required to let their pets out at least twice a day for a total of one hour under the terms of proposed new regulations.

item.title: Mittens the cat is in the running for New Zealander of the Year
item.description: Mittens the cat, a famous feline from Wellington, is in the running to be voted New Zealander of the Year, going up against Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern and Director-General of Health Dr. Ashley Bloomfield.

item.title: Volkswagen now has another electric SUV to take on Tesla
item.description: Production has started in Germany on the first electric SUV from the Volkswagen brand, marking the latest push by the world's largest carmaker into cleaner vehicles.

item.title: The world's largest painting is being made in a Dubai hotel ballroom by this artist
item.description: A British artist has taken over the ballroom of a luxury hotel in Dubai to produce the largest painting ever created on canvas.

item.title: The 13-year-old aiming to become Ferrari's first female Formula 1 driver
item.description: "My favorite part of racing is the speed."

item.title: Mouth breathing might be ruining your sleep. Here's how to fix it
item.description: Living with a plugged nose isn't fun, but James Nestor was ready. Plus, it was for science.

item.title: How Tokyo's massive lost & found works
item.description: The bad news—you lost your wallet in Tokyo. The good news—chances are good you will get it back, along with all the cash tucked inside. In Japan, residents are diligent about making sure what's lost is found and returned to its rightful owner. This is how the city's stunningly efficient Lost & Found system works.

item.title: World's second 'Making of Harry Potter' attraction to open
item.description: Great news for Japan-based muggles in need of a bit more magic in their lives -- a new 30,000-square-meter Harry Potter attraction is coming to Tokyo.

item.title: Jim Belushi believes this would have saved his brother John
item.description: Actor Jim Belushi is so pro-cannabis that he's now in the industry and says he believes his brother John would still be alive if he had been a "pot head."

item.title: Google Maps has a new, more colorful look
item.description: Google Maps just unveiled its latest redesign. The new maps are more colorful and show more details so users can better understand what kind of terrain they're looking at.

item.title: Broadcaster leaves MLB game broadcast after uttering anti-gay slur on air
item.description: A broadcaster who was heard uttering a homophobic slur on an MLB game broadcast left the booth during the contest Wednesday.

item.title: Judged for what he wore: A first-time author writes about class and clothing
item.description: At student club nights in my first few weeks of university, more than once I was asked whether I had any drugs to sell. It's true that Oxford was -- and remains -- very White, but race didn't fully explain it. There were plenty of other young South Asian men. What made them so different to 18-year-old me? It slowly became clear that it was blazers, chinos, boat shoes and, yes, Oxford shirts.

item.title: Federal prosecutors charged President Trump's former adviser with defrauding donors in a border wall fundraising campaign
item.description: • LIVE UPDATES: Bannon is among four people arrested

item.title: Bannon could face many years in jail, analysts say
Bannon's arrest is the perfect symbol of the Trump era
item.description: The arrest of former White House political adviser Steve Bannon Thursday on charges of fraud related to fundraising for the construction of a private border wall with Mexico is, quite literally, the single most emblematic storyline of the Trump era in Washington.

item.title: Barack Obama issues a stunning rebuke of Trump
item.description: • Watch: Obama's full speech to convention • Opinion: Biden can use speech to fire Trump • Analysis: The shoutouts by Kamala Harris that mean more than you realize

item.title: Russian opposition leader seen 'groaning loudly' on plane after alleged poisoning
A controversy in Australia signals the next Covid nightmare
WHO: 26,000 daily new cases in Europe since restrictions eased
